title: How to Put Out a Candle with Your Fingers

steps.headline: Light your candle.
steps.description: It should be at least 1 inch (2.5 cm)  high and freestanding. Make sure you can pull your hand away quickly.

steps.headline: Lick your fingers.
steps.description: This is an important part of the process. Do not skip it! Licking your fingers adds a layer of water that protects your skin from getting burned

steps.headline: Place your hand about 1 inch (2.5 cm) away from the flame/wick.
Quickly grab the wick and then let go.
steps.description: This should put out your flame. If it does not, blow out your candle, shorten your wick and try again.

steps.headline: Practice.
steps.description: Eventually with practice you can do this without licking your fingers, but you must master the timing first. Be warned!
